div.div: The mission of CCS is to inspire all students to become lifelong learners in the pursuit of excellence. To support this mission, we offer many academic, athletic, and artistic options for our students to grow and learn beyond the typical classroom experience.

img.alt: School Closures Extended Through End of the School Year

div.a: School Closures Extended Through End of the School Year

article.a: Continue Reading This Article about School Closures Extended Through End of the School Year

span.b: Information Regarding Student Meal Services Following Spring Break

div.sub: Meal pick-up and delivery services have been revised to limit exposure and contact with groups of more than 10 people. We will continue to follow the CDC's guidance to protect our students, staff and families. The program will continue as it is currently operating and will change following spring break. Meals will be delivered and available at feeding sites on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays. On Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, students will receive hot meals along with bagged lunches for the following days. On Thursdays, students will receive 4 breakfast meals and 4 lunch meals to ensure they have meals for Friday. Our goal is to limit exposure, but also make sure we are meeting the nutritional needs of our students.

If you would prefer to pick up a lunch or breakfast, you may do so by visiting Calhoun Elementary School between the hours of 11:00 AM - 1:00 PM, Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. Someone will be stationed behind the school where carpool pickup/drop off is located. Additional Meal Pick-Up Locations include Belmont Baptist Church (275 West Belmont Drive) and The Voluntary Action Center (343 S. Wall Street) at the same times of 11:00AM-1:00PM on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday. Note that these locations are in addition to the pick-up location at Calhoun Elementary School and bus routes.
Please click on the following link to view approximate bus arrival times for the school closure meal delivery times CLICK HERE This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.p:
334 South Wall Street
Calhoun, GA 30701
Phone: 706-629-2900
Fax: 706-629-3235
OUR MISSION IS TO INSPIRE ALL STUDENTS TO BECOME LIFE-LONG LEARNERS IN THE PURSUIT OF EXCELLENCE
